{{disambig-two|the term in ''The New Shadow''|[[Black Númenóreans|Black Númenórean]]|[[Herumor]]}}
[[File:Álvaro Fernández González - The New Shadow.jpg|thumb|An artwork by [[:Category:Images by Álvaro Fernández González|Álvaro Fernández González]]]]
'''Herumor''' was a term used by a growing [[Dark Tree|dark cult]] in [[Gondor]] during the [[Fourth Age]], over one hundred years into the reign of [[Eldarion]].<ref name=history>{{PM|Shadow}}, pp. 414, 417</ref>

Around {{FoA|220}},<ref name=Eldarion>{{L|338}}</ref> a secret cult worshipping the [[Dark Lord]] used the term Herumor to denote something of significance. Whether Herumor was the name of a person, an alias, a concept, or even a code word is not known. It is known, however, that the term was used in whispers in opposition against [[Eldarion]] in the [[Reunited Kingdom]].<ref name=history/>

Sometime in the early months of the year 220<ref name=Eldarion/>, [[Borlas]] of [[Pen-arduin]] picked up on the whispers of Herumor from a man named [[Othrondir]]. Later on, during a discussion with [[Saelon]] in [[June]], he briefly pondered how Saelon had heard the name.<ref name=history/>
